title: How to Unblock Facebook at School

steps.title: Open a browser.
steps.content: Open a browser. You may need to sign into the browser with your student credentials before you can proceed.

steps.title: Type m.facebook.com into your browser's address bar.
steps.content: Type m.facebook.com into your browser's address bar. This is the address for the Facebook mobile site.

steps.title: Press ↵ Enter.
steps.content: Press ↵ Enter . If your school's network only has "facebook.com" blocked, this takes you to the Facebook mobile site. The Facebook mobile site looks different than the regular desktop Facebook site, but it functions the same.

steps.title: Open a browser.
steps.content: Open a browser. This will likely be your computer's default browser. If Facebook is blocked specifically in your current browser, using a different browser may solve the problem. If you can't download a browser on your current computer, you can download it at home and put it on a flash drive .

steps.title: Go to your preferred browser's download page.
steps.content: Go to your preferred browser's download page. Some popular browsers include the following: Google Chrome - https://www.google.com/chrome/browser/desktop/index.html Firefox - https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/new/?f=118 Opera - http://www.opera.com/

steps.title: Click the "Download" button.
steps.content: Click the "Download" button. This is usually a button near the top or middle of the browser's web page. Doing so will cause the browser's setup file to begin downloading to your computer. Depending on your current browser, you may first have to click Save or confirm your choice, or select a download location (e.g., Desktop ).

steps.title: Double-click the setup file.
steps.content: Double-click the setup file. It will be in your computer's default download location (or your specified download location if you selected one).

steps.title: Install the browser.
steps.content: Install the browser. To do so: Windows - Follow the on-screen prompts. Make sure you opt out of any free programs included in the install (e.g., antivirus or search programs). Mac - Drag the browser's icon into the "Applications" folder shortcut.

steps.title: Open your new browser.
steps.content: Open your new browser. Double-click the browser's icon to do so.

steps.title: Go to Facebook's website.
steps.content: Go to Facebook's website. Go to https://www.facebook.com/ in your new browser. If your computer's restrictions were only set up in the default browser, you should be able to access Facebook.

steps.title: Open Start .
steps.content: Open Start . Click the Windows logo in the bottom-left corner of the screen, or press ⊞ Win .

steps.title: Type command prompt into Start.
steps.content: Type command prompt into Start. This will search your computer for Command Prompt .

steps.title: Click Command Prompt.
steps.content: Click Command Prompt. It's at the top of the Start window.

steps.title: Type ping facebook.com into Command Prompt and press ↵ Enter.
steps.content: Type ping facebook.com into Command Prompt and press ↵ Enter . You'll see a series of numbers and periods to the right of the "Pinging facebook.com" heading; this is Facebook's IP address.

steps.title: Open a browser.
steps.content: Open a browser.

steps.title: Type the IP address into the browser's address bar and press ↵ Enter.
steps.content: Type the IP address into the browser's address bar and press ↵ Enter . If the Facebook URL is blocked but the IP address isn't, this will take you to Facebook's page.

steps.title: Open Spotlight .
steps.content: Open Spotlight . It's in the top-right corner of the screen.

steps.title: Type terminal into Spotlight.
steps.content: Type terminal into Spotlight. This searches your computer for the Terminal app.

steps.title: Double-click Terminal.
steps.content: Double-click Terminal. It should be the top search result. Doing so opens Terminal.

steps.title: Type ping facebook.com into Terminal and press ↵ Enter.
steps.content: Type ping facebook.com into Terminal and press ↵ Enter .

steps.title: Look at the number to the right of "[Number] bytes from".
steps.content: Look at the number to the right of "[Number] bytes from". This is Facebook's IP address.

steps.title: Open a browser.
steps.content: Open a browser.

steps.title: Type the IP address into the browser's address bar and press ⏎ Return.
steps.content: Type the IP address into the browser's address bar and press ⏎ Return . If the Facebook URL is blocked but the IP address isn't, this will take you to Facebook's page.

steps.title: Connect your iPhone to your computer.
steps.content: Connect your iPhone to your computer. Use the USB charger cable that came with your iPhone. If using your phone's charger isn't an option, you can try using your iPhone's Wi-Fi hotspot instead.

steps.title: Open your iPhone's Settings .
steps.content: Open your iPhone's Settings . It's a grey app with gears on it. You'll likely find this app on the Home Screen.

steps.title: Tap Personal Hotspot.
steps.content: Tap Personal Hotspot . This option is near the top of the Settings page. Not all service providers include a Personal Hotspot. If you don't see this option, your phone doesn't have a hotspot available.

steps.title: Slide Personal Hotspot right to "On" .
steps.content: Slide Personal Hotspot right to "On" . After a second or two, your computer will begin using your phone's data as an Internet connection.

steps.title: Open a web browser.
steps.content: Open a web browser. Do this on your computer.

steps.title: Type facebook.com into your browser's address bar, then press ↵ Enter.
steps.content: Type facebook.com into your browser's address bar, then press ↵ Enter . This should take you to Facebook's home page. If Facebook is blocked on your computer specifically, even this method won't work for connecting to Facebook.

steps.title: Connect your Android to your computer.
steps.content: Connect your Android to your computer. You'll use your Android's charger cable to do so. If using your phone's charger isn't an option, you can try using your Android's Wi-Fi hotspot instead.

steps.title: Open your Android's Settings .
steps.content: Open your Android's Settings . It's a gear-shaped app that you'll find in the App Drawer.

steps.title: Tap More.
steps.content: Tap More . This option is beneath the "Wireless & networks" heading. On a Samsung device, tap Connections .

steps.title: Tap Tethering & portable hotspot.
steps.content: Tap Tethering & portable hotspot . It's near the top of the page. On a Samsung, tap Tethering and Mobile HotSpot .

steps.title: Slide USB tethering right to "ON" .
steps.content: Slide USB tethering right to "ON" . After doing this, your computer will begin using your Android's data as an Internet connection. On some Androids, you'll check the USB tethering box instead.

steps.title: Open a web browser.
steps.content: Open a web browser. Do this on your computer.

steps.title: Type facebook.com into your browser's address bar, then press ↵ Enter.
steps.content: Type facebook.com into your browser's address bar, then press ↵ Enter . This should take you to Facebook's home page. If Facebook is blocked on your computer specifically, even this method won't work for connecting to Facebook.

steps.title: Open a browser.
steps.content: Open a browser. You may have to enter your student credentials before continuing.

steps.title: Search for online proxies.
steps.content: Search for online proxies. Type free online proxies 2017 into your browser's search bar and press ↵ Enter . Some reputable proxy services include the following: [1] X Research source Anonymouse VPNBook FilterBypass

steps.title: Type facebook.com into the proxy site's search bar.
steps.content: Type facebook.com into the proxy site's search bar. There will usually be a search bar in the middle of the proxy site's page.

steps.title: Click the "Search" button.
steps.content: Click the "Search" button. This button will usually be below the search field. Doing so will run the Facebook search through the proxy, which will cause it to avoid your school's network.

steps.title: Make sure you're subscribed to a VPN service.
steps.content: Make sure you're subscribed to a VPN service. Unlike using a proxy site, virtual private networks (VPNs) require you to set up an account in order to access a server's name and address. You will need the VPN's name and address, as well as login credentials, to connect to a VPN. If you want to use your VPN service for longer than a week or so, you'll usually have to pay for it. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Open Start .
steps.content: Open Start . Click the Windows logo in the bottom-left corner of the screen, or press the ⊞ Win key.

steps.title: Click Settings .
steps.content: Click Settings . It's in the bottom-left side of the Start window.

steps.title: Click Network & Internet.
steps.content: Click Network & Internet. This option is in the top row of settings on the Windows Settings page.

steps.title: Click VPN.
steps.content: Click VPN . It's a tab on the left side of the window.

steps.title: Click Add a VPN connection.
steps.content: Click Add a VPN connection . This option is at the top of the VPN page.

steps.title: Select a VPN provider.
steps.content: Select a VPN provider. Click the box below the "VPN provider" heading at the top of the page, then click Windows (built-in) .

steps.title: Enter your VPN's information.
steps.content: Enter your VPN's information. This includes the following: Connection name - Type a name for your VPN connection into the Connection name field. Server name or address - This is where you'll enter your VPN's address. VPN type - Click the box below this heading to select your VPN's connection type. You should receive this information along with the VPN's address when signing up for the VPN. Sign-in info - Depending on your VPN, this section will vary. You'll usually enter your username and password here.

steps.title: Click Save.
steps.content: Click Save . Doing so saves your VPN connection as a network on your PC.

steps.title: Click your VPN's name.
steps.content: Click your VPN's name. It should now be on the VPN page of the Settings window.

steps.title: Click Connect.
steps.content: Click Connect . This option is at the bottom of the VPN's name card.

steps.title: Enter your username and password if prompted.
steps.content: Enter your username and password if prompted. If you didn't select the option to have your VPN save your login credentials while creating it, you'll need to log into your VPN service and click OK to finish connecting to the VPN.

steps.title: Go to Facebook's website in your preferred web browser.
steps.content: Go to Facebook's website in your preferred web browser. Go to https://www.facebook.com and log in. As long as you're connected to a VPN, you should be able to use Facebook.

steps.title: Make sure you're subscribed to a VPN service.
steps.content: Make sure you're subscribed to a VPN service. Unlike using a proxy site, virtual private networks (VPNs) require you to set up an account in order to access a server's name and address. You will need the VPN's name and address, as well as login credentials, to connect to a VPN. If you want to use your VPN service for longer than a week or so, you'll usually have to pay for it.

steps.title: Open the Apple menu .
steps.content: Open the Apple menu . It's in the top-left corner of the screen.

steps.title: Click System Preferences.
steps.content: Click System Preferences . This option is near the top of the Apple drop-down menu.

steps.title: Click Network.
steps.content: Click Network . It's a purple globe-shaped icon.

steps.title: Click +.
steps.content: Click + . This option is in the bottom-left corner of the Network page, just below the list of network names.

steps.title: Select the VPN option.
steps.content: Select the VPN option. Click the box to the right of "Interface:", then click VPN in the drop-down menu.

steps.title: Select a VPN connection type.
steps.content: Select a VPN connection type. Click the box to the right of "VPN Type", then select your VPN's connection type (e.g., L2TP over IPSec ). The VPN's site should provide this information. MacOS Sierra does not support PPTP connections.

steps.title: Enter a name for your VPN.
steps.content: Enter a name for your VPN. This can be whatever you want to name the network.

steps.title: Click Create.
steps.content: Click Create . It's the blue button in the bottom-right corner of the window.

steps.title: Configure your VPN.
steps.content: Configure your VPN. Enter the following information: Configuration - Make sure this box says "Default". Server Address - Type in your VPN's address here. Account Name - Type in your subscription's account name here.

steps.title: Click Authentication Settings.
steps.content: Click Authentication Settings . It's below the Account Name text field.

steps.title: Type in your User Authentication information.
steps.content: Type in your User Authentication information. Check the box to the left of your VPN's User Authentication option (e.g., Password ) and then type the answer in.

steps.title: Type in your Machine Authentication information.
steps.content: Type in your Machine Authentication information. This section is near the bottom of the window. Most VPNs use the "Shared Secret" option; check this box, then enter your VPN's shared secret phrase.

steps.title: Click OK.
steps.content: Click OK . It's near the bottom of the Authentication Settings window.

steps.title: Click Advanced.
steps.content: Click Advanced . It's near the bottom of the window.

steps.title: Check the "Send all traffic over VPN connection" box, then click OK.
steps.content: Check the "Send all traffic over VPN connection" box, then click OK . This ensures that all sites you visit will use the VPN connection.

steps.title: Click Apply.
steps.content: Click Apply . This saves your VPN settings and creates your network.

steps.title: Click Connect.
steps.content: Click Connect . It's below the Authentication Settings option. Doing so will prompt your Mac to connect to the VPN.

steps.title: Go to Facebook's website in your preferred web browser.
steps.content: Go to Facebook's website in your preferred web browser. Go to https://www.facebook.com and log in. As long as you're connected to a VPN, you should be able to use Facebook.
